Description: Shallow asymmetrical arsenical copper axe-head: of quite rough work. It is a little warped and has an uneven butt. The upper end is squared, the lower rounded. There are five binding-holes. The blade is quite thickly corroded and the cutting edge is damaged. The line of the haft is preserved.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (75)
